description_txt: stated on September 12, 2013 in a press conference:
quote_txt: According to the most recent jobs report, "we've got more Americans leaving the workforce than we have finding jobs."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2013 in a news conference.:
quote_txt: "I’ve never supported legislation that invades people’s choices about contraception."

description_txt: stated on July 20, 2013 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: The very first meal on the surface of the moon was the Holy Communion.

description_txt: stated on August 29, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Minnesota is kicking butt relative to Wisconsin on everything from employment and job creation to school test scores, educated work force and a host of other factors and rankings"

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in an e-mailed campaign letter:
quote_txt: Newark is "now home to one-third of all commercial and multi-family development."

description_txt: stated on August 23, 2013 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: "The amount of interest" paid on the federal debt exceeds "total tax revenue."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2013 in a website:

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2013 in an opinion column in Fort Worth Star-Telegram:

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2013 in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: "Things like … having Friday classes have been shown to be very effective on college campuses" in reducing drinking.

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2013 in a CNN interview:
quote_txt: The United States "stood alone in the war in Iraq."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2013 in an interview on MSNBC’s “All In”:
quote_txt: Says he "opposed the president’s decision to go into Iraq" in 2003.

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2013 in a statement:
quote_txt: On support for a military strike on Syria

description_txt: stated on August 17, 2013 in a speech to Louisiana Democrats:
quote_txt: In 2012, the state "put together a list of over 100,000 people that they thought were ineligible to vote. Came out there were less than 10."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: President Barack Obama "had the legal authority" to strike Syria without a vote from Congress.

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: The United Nations has conducted "172 successful peacekeeping missions and negotiations."

description_txt: stated on August 29, 2013 in a published commentary:
quote_txt: Pending a federal waiver, the 2013 Legislature "eliminated the overtesting of students in grades 3-8 by decreasing the number of tests from 17 to 8."

description_txt: stated on August 19, 2013 in an interview on Austin's YNN:
quote_txt: There "are 500 registered Republicans moving" to Texas "every day."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in at Suncoast Tiger Bay luncheon:
quote_txt: "One out of every three students currently today is ready for college before they go there."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2013 in an interview with the "Washington Post":
quote_txt: In the event of a U.S. strike on Syria, "the Russians will replace the weapons immediately. They’ve said it on the record. They’ve suggested they might even replace it with better stuff."

description_txt: stated on August 7, 2013 in website materials :
quote_txt: "7 out of 10 Oregon families living in poverty have at least one parent who works."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in a web posting:
quote_txt: "The Kenosha casino would be one of the state’s largest employers and pay more to the state than any other company or Tribe – essentially, it would be Wisconsin’s biggest taxpayer."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2013 in an interview on CNN's 'Crossfire':
quote_txt: "We've seen priests beheaded by the Islamic rebels on the other side. We've also seen an Islamic rebel eating the heart of a soldier."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2013 in a segment of 'Fox News Sunday':
quote_txt: "Before President Obama acted in Libya in 2011, the American people were opposed to military action by 35 to 60. After he took action, they were in support of it 54 to 43."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2013 in an interview on Fox Business Network:
quote_txt: Chemical weapons have been used "probably 20 times" since the Persian Gulf War.

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: "The government does not need a warrant to read your old emails."
